channel.title: Need help with this code please just } error

item.title: Need help with this code please just } error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:2, topic:537813”][quote author=wukey link=topic=656640.msg4393523#msg4393523 date=1388402367]
client.java:4869: error: missing return statement
}
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

}

if(FullVeracEquipped()) {
if(misc.random(2) == 1){
hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit) + misc.random(StrPrayer);
}

I did try and do it but i get more errors 100 more infact
[/quote]

if(FullVeracEquipped()) { if(misc.random(2) == 1){ hitDiff = misc.random(playerMaxHit) + misc.random(StrPrayer); } else { return; }

Not sure, on Mobile atm. Post errors.[/quote]
Close.

OP put an if-statement inside of a boolean, int, or other datatype and it doesn’t return anything.

What needs to be returned is unknown since we don’t know the datatype.

Examples:

public int anInt1(int anInt2){
     if(anInt2 >1)
          return 1;
     else
    return 100;
}
public boolean aBoolean1(){
     return aBoolean1;
}
//Your error:
public int anInt3(int anInt4){//Like I said, I don't know what you need to return, but I know you aren't returning it.
     if(anInt4 == 1){
          return 12;
     }else if(anInt4 >50){
          return 12;
     }//It would error out because on the chance that anInt4 is NOT 1 and NOT above 50, nothing is returned.
}

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with this code please just } error
